title: Hello Mini: This Promising Thriller Series Is Bound To Keep You On The Edge!
text:
If there’s one thing MX Player has mastered, it’s knowing how to compel the viewers to binge-watch a series. Recently, the leading streaming entertainment platform rolled out an erotic psychological thriller ‘Hello Mini’ and believe me, it’s as progressive, bold and exciting as it gets. It is an onscreen adaptation of the page-turning novel “Marry Me, Stranger” by Novoneel Chakraborty.

To give you a better idea about the show, here’s a quick round-up of the deciding factors.

Here’s What We Think About The Plot

The story revolves around 22-year-old Rivannah who recently shifted to Mumbai. However, looks like she hasn’t come alone. There’s someone following her - a deranged stalker who’d go to unimaginable lengths to make her life miserable. An air of eeriness traces the course of the show, as the protagonist struggles with frantic phone-calls, creepy messages, someone who’s constantly tracking every footstep of hers, even at her apartment.

Additionally, the plot is strategically intertwined with instances of harassment, mental illness, infidelity, and a lot of “Oh My God” moments.

The genuine direction brings out the horror of stalking in ways more than one and succeeds in making the show an edge-of-the-seat watch.

That was really something!



Actors Bring Their A-Game To The Series

The cast does a stellar job in padding out the episodes with their convincing performances. Anuja Joshi (as Rivannah) is comfortably bold, winging the independent girl in a city avatar. Be it a steamy scene or a high-tension stalking sequence, she’s got her A-game on. Priya Bannerjee (as Ishita) plays the free-spirited girl to the T. In addition to this, Ankur Rathee (as Abhiraj Mukherjee), and Arjun Aneja (as HR Prateek Basotia) deliver convincing performances as well. The plot has a lot of layers, and the cast does a fine job at bringing them alive on screen.

Our Verdict

'Hello Mini' Season 1 makes for a smooth binge-watch, thanks to its strategically placed cliffhangers, powerful performances, and the myriad of important issues it discusses. All 15 episodes of the show are streaming free on MX Player. Check it out now!
